description: [Status: stable] [Name: camelcase-imported-as-lowercase] [Message: Camelcase {name} imported as lowercase {asname}] What it does Checks for CamelCase imports that are aliased to lowercase names. Why is this bad? PEP 8 recommends naming conventions for classes, functions, constants, and more. The use of inconsistent naming styles between import and alias names may lead readers to expect an import to be of another type (e.g., confuse a Python class with a constant). Import aliases should thus follow the same naming style as the member being imported. Example from example import MyClassName as myclassname Use instead: from example import MyClassName

lint.pep8-naming.ignore-names.option_description:
A list of names (or patterns) to ignore when considering pep8-naming violations.

Supports glob patterns. For example, to ignore all names starting with test_
or ending with _test, you could use ignore-names = ["test_*", "*_test"].
For more information on the glob syntax, refer to the globset documentation.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.pep8-naming]
ignore-names = ["callMethod"]



[lint.pep8-naming]
ignore-names = ["callMethod"]

lint.pep8-naming.extend-ignore-names.option_description:
Additional names (or patterns) to ignore when considering pep8-naming violations,
in addition to those included in ignore-names.

Supports glob patterns. For example, to ignore all names starting with test_
or ending with _test, you could use ignore-names = ["test_*", "*_test"].
For more information on the glob syntax, refer to the globset documentation.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.pep8-naming]
extend-ignore-names = ["callMethod"]



[lint.pep8-naming]
extend-ignore-names = ["callMethod"]
